title: Midfield boy, 11, dies in what authorities believe was accidental shooting
content:
MIDFIELD, Alabama - An 11-year-old Midfield boy died after what authorities say was an accidental shooting at a friend's home.
The shooting happened about 10:19 p.m. July 2, according to the Jefferson County Coroner's Office. Christian Alexander Jones was pronounced dead the following day at 1:55 p.m. at Children's of Alabama.
Authorities said Christian's friend found him wounded and on his back in his friend's bedroom. The friend had been in the room with him a short time before that.
The friend told authorities Christian had a gun in his hand. The friend removed the gun and put it in a drawer before authorities arrived on the scene.
Christian was taken to Children's where he later died. Repeated efforts to reach Midfield police for comment were unsuccessful.
